constraint.rule: Arrays must be JSON-stringified before storing in Dexie: foodIds and portionMap must use JSON.stringify() on write and JSON.parse() on read per AGENTS.md convention.
portionMap structure must be Record<foodId: string, portionSize: 'small' | 'medium' | 'large'> with all selected foods included before save.
mealId must be unique uuid generated once per meal using generateId() utility. Same mealId links all foods in a meal for grouping queries.
Minimum 1 food must be selected before saving meal. Validate foodIds array length > 0 in save handler and repository.
MealType enum must be one of: 'breakfast', 'lunch', 'dinner', 'snack'. Repository already validates this. UI selector enforces valid values.
Notes field character limit: 500 characters max. Show character counter in UI. Validate before save.
Meal composition persistence must complete in <500ms (matches Story 1.1 quick-log target). Test with 10+ food selections.
Timeline meal hydration should use memoization to avoid re-fetching food records. Batch getByIds() calls for efficiency.
Query meals using compound indexes: [userId+mealId] for grouping, [userId+timestamp] for timeline chronological ordering. Never scan full table.
All meal composition operations must persist to Dexie/IndexedDB immediately without network dependency. Follow existing repository patterns.
Use functional components with function syntax (not arrow functions). Extract stateful logic to custom hooks. Follow FoodLogModal patterns.
Multi-select food list must support keyboard navigation (arrow keys, Enter to add, Delete to remove). WCAG 2.1 AA compliance required.
Portion size selectors must have clear ARIA labels and sufficient color contrast. Use segmented buttons or radio groups for keyboard access.
80% minimum test coverage required across branches, functions, lines, statements per AGENTS.md. MealComposer: 15+ tests, repository extensions: 10+ tests, timeline: 5+ tests.

architecture-notes.note: MealComposer should be a child component of FoodLogModal, positioned after food search/selection UI. It displays selected foods as chips/cards with portion selectors and remove buttons. State managed in FoodLogModal with props passed to MealComposer for rendering and callbacks for updates.

User selects food → Added to selectedFoods array in FoodLogModal state → MealComposer renders food chip with default "medium" portion → User adjusts portion → portionMap updates in FoodLogModal state → Save validates ≥1 food → Constructs payload → Calls foodEventRepository.create() → Returns mealId → Shows success toast → Closes modal.

Timeline queries meals via foodEventRepository.findByDateRange() → For each meal event, parse foodIds JSON array → Batch query foodRepository.getByIds(foodIds) to hydrate food details → Render grouped display with meal type icon, food names with portions, timestamp → Expandable view shows notes, allergen tags, edit/delete actions.

Timeline edit button captures meal event ID → Opens FoodLogModal in edit mode with pre-filled state: selectedFoods from foodIds, portionMap from portionMap JSON, mealType, notes → User modifies → Save calls foodEventRepository.update(id, changes) → Preserves original mealId → Updates updatedAt timestamp → Shows "Meal updated" toast.

Critical pattern from AGENTS.md: Arrays and objects must be JSON-stringified before Dexie storage. foodIds: JSON.stringify(selectedFoodIds) on save, JSON.parse(event.foodIds) on read. portionMap: JSON.stringify(portionMapObject) on save, JSON.parse(event.portionMap) on read. Always validate parsed data structure.

Smart defaults based on time of day: getDefaultMealType() utility function. const hour = new Date().getHours(); if (hour >= 5 && hour < 10) return 'breakfast'; if (hour >= 11 && hour < 14) return 'lunch'; if (hour >= 17 && hour < 21) return 'dinner'; return 'snack'. Use on modal open, allow user override.

Use segmented button group (3 buttons: S/M/L) for portion selection per food. Visual design: active button highlighted, clear focus indicators, keyboard navigation (Tab to move, Enter/Space to select). Consider using Lucide icons: CircleSmall, Circle, CircleLarge or text labels with size indicators.

Timeline meal hydration: Use React useMemo to cache food details lookups. Batch getByIds() calls instead of individual queries. Consider lazy loading meal details (collapsed by default, expand on click to hydrate). Measure timeline render time with performance marks.

MealComposer multi-select: Use role="listbox" with aria-multiselectable="true". Selected foods as role="option" with aria-selected. Remove buttons have aria-label="Remove [food name]". Portion selectors as radio groups with aria-labelledby. Notes textarea with aria-describedby for character count. Keyboard: Arrow keys navigate, Enter adds, Delete removes.
